wikipedia_page.main: Robert John Napier (born 23 September 1946) is a Northern Irish former football centre half and manager, who currently teaches soccer in San Diego, California.

response: *John Napier (footballer) (born 1946), birth name Robert John Napier

Wright returned to Walsall in 1973 for a fee of £10,000, and scored 38 goals in 152 league games during his four years at Fellows Park. After struggling in the lower half of the table in 1972–73 and 1973–74 under John Smith and then Ronnie Allen, the "Saddlers" came close to promotion in 1974–75 and 1975–76 under Doug Fraser's stewardship. He joined Bobby Kennedy's Bradford City in 1976, where he scored 13 goals in 66 league games. Bradford won promotion out of the Fourth Division in 1976–77, but suffered relegation in 1977–78 under John Napier. Wright and Don Hutchins were joint-top scorer in 1977–78 with ten goals.

In November 1978 he moved to Bradford City to replace John Napier as manager. In his first full season he guided the club to 5th in Division Four before he was tempted back to Bolton in March 1981. He managed Bolton for one year until he was sacked. He served as a scout at Ipswich Town and assistant manager at Tranmere Rovers. He later returned to Halifax Town as joint manager with Kieran O'Regan and got them promoted back into the Football League in 1998, at which point Mulhall retired.
John Napier (1550–1617) was a Scottish mathematician, physicist and astronomer.
John Napier may also refer to:
*John Napier (designer) (born 1944), theatre set designer, recipient of many Tony and Olivier awards
*John Napier (footballer) (born 1946), Irish-born footballer and manager, notably with Bradford City A.F.C.
*Sir John Napier, 4th Baronet (1636–1711), English landowner and politician
